metadata.title: CVE-2014-9112 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the process_copy_in function in GNU Cpio 2.11allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a large blockvalue in a cpio archive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9112` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpio - 2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cpio package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
